title: Exercises: Trimester Review & Final Project Proposal

items.title: Exercise 1: Proposal Executive Summary (Doc A)
items.text:
Doc A — Executive Summary: Automated Vendor Vetting System

Introduction: This proposal outlines a project to streamline our current vendor vetting process, which has become a significant bottleneck in our operations. If we had automated this last quarter, we wouldn't be facing the current backlog of approvals (Mixed Conditional).

Solution: We propose to implement 'VetScan', a software tool that will be monitoring vendor compliance in real-time (Future Continuous). By the end of Q1, we will have integrated all existing vendor data into the new system (Future Perfect).

Risk Assessment: The primary risk is staff resistance to the new workflow. Our mitigation strategy involves holding three training workshops. Under no circumstances should the legacy system be deactivated before the new data is fully reconciled.

KPI: 50% reduction in approval time.

questions.question: What is the primary goal of the 'VetScan' project?
options: To streamline the vendor vetting process and reduce bottlenecks.
To deactivate the legacy system immediately.
questions.explanation: Doc A states the proposal outlines a project to 'streamline our current vendor vetting process'.

questions.question: By when does the proposal expect all vendor data to be integrated?
options: By the end of this week.
By the middle of next month.
questions.explanation: Doc A mentions: 'By the end of Q1, we will have integrated all existing vendor data'.

items.prompt: Exercise 2: Proposal Structure. Which section provides a 'high-level overview of the proposed change'?
items.explanation: The Executive Summary is a high-level overview of the entire proposal.

items.prompt: Exercise 3: Grammar Synthesis. When analyzing a past failure using 'If + Past Perfect, would have + past participle', which conditional are you using?
items.explanation: The Third Conditional is used to analyze hypothetical past events.

items.prompt: Exercise 4: Review Vocabulary. Complete the sentence: 'This week we will ___ our learning to demonstrate our ___ in administrative tasks.'
items.explanation: To 'synthesise' learning is to combine it to show 'competency' (ability).

items.prompt: Exercise 5: Mixed Conditionals Review. Form a sentence linking a past action to a present result (e.g., 'not hire the consultant' / 'be in trouble now').
items.modelAnswer: If we had hired the consultant, we wouldn't be in trouble now.

items.prompt: Exercise 6: Future Tenses Review. Describe your work status for next Friday at 3 PM using both Future Continuous and Future Perfect (e.g., 'working on the pitch' / 'finish the slides').
items.modelAnswer: At 3 PM next Friday, I will be working on the pitch, and by 5 PM, I will have finished the slides.

items.prompt: Exercise 7: Extracting Action Points. Based on Doc A, list the 2 main sections of the proposal and one specific task mentioned in each.
items.modelAnswer: 1. Solution: Implement 'VetScan' software. 2. Risk Assessment: Hold three training workshops.

items.prompt: Exercise 8: Courtesy Modals. Which is the most professional way to ask for a final review of your project proposal?
options: Could you please review my final project proposal? I’m aiming to submit the final version by Friday EOD and would value your feedback.
I've finished the proposal. When will you read it?
Final project attached. Tell me what's wrong.
items.explanation: This option is polite, sets a clear timeframe, and uses professional language.

items.prompt: Exercise 9: Submission Email. Write a 50-word email submitting your final project. Use a relative clause to describe the proposal.
items.modelAnswer: Dear Sarah, please find attached my final project proposal, which focuses on streamlining our procurement workflow. I believe the solution I have proposed will mitigate our current risk of delays. I look forward to your feedback. Best regards, [Your Name]

items.prompt: Exercise 10: Operational Logic. Matching trimester concepts: Which term refers to 'the uncontrolled expansion of a project'?
items.explanation: Scope creep refers to the uncontrolled expansion of project requirements.

items.prompt: Exercise 11: Oral Pitch Prep. Prepare a script for a 5-minute pitch of your 'VetScan' proposal (Doc A). You must cover: The bottleneck, the solution, a risk, and a milestone using the Future Perfect.
items.modelAnswer: [Audio Upload Required] Rubric: Comprehensive coverage, Synthesised vocabulary, Persuasive delivery.

items.prompt: Exercise 12: Oral Reflection. Record a 2-minute audio reflecting on your growth this trimester. Mention one administrative skill you have improved and one grammatical structure you find most useful for your work.
items.modelAnswer: [Audio Upload Required] Checklist: Self-evaluation, Use of B2 level vocabulary, Fluency.

items.prompt: Exercise 13: Final Project Proposal (Portfolio). Write a 300-word proposal to improve 'Office Meeting Efficiency'. Use: Executive Summary, Current Situation, Solution (with Future Tenses), and Risk Assessment (with Conditionals).
items.modelAnswer:
Executive Summary: This proposal aims to streamline our internal meetings by introducing 'Lean Agendas'. 

Current Situation: We currently spend 10 hours per week in meetings, many of which lack clear action items. This has become a bottleneck for our core operations.

Proposed Solution: Next month, we will be implementing a 15-minute standing meeting policy. By the end of the month, we will have reduced our total meeting time by 30%. 

Risk Assessment: If we hadn't experienced so much fatigue from long meetings, there wouldn't be such a strong case for this change now. If a meeting were to overrun, the chair would have to adjourn it immediately. 

We believe this pivot will lead to greater accountability and efficiency across the team.

items.prompt: Exercise 14: Skill Matrix. Complete a table for 3 skills you learned this trimester. Format: Skill | Confidence (1-10) | Example of use.
items.modelAnswer: 1. Minute-Taking | 9 | Wrote minutes for the Q3 review. 2. Risk Management | 8 | Created a risk register for the BBQ. 3. Managing Up | 7 | Proposed a solution to my boss.

items.prompt: Exercise 15: Trimester Mini-test. 1) Define 'Scope Creep'. 2) Give an example of a Third Conditional. 3) What is the difference between a defining and non-defining relative clause? 4) List 4 project phases.
items.modelAnswer: 1) Uncontrolled expansion of project requirements. 2) If I had known, I would have helped. 3) Defining is essential (no commas); Non-defining is extra info (commas). 4) Initiation, Planning, Execution, Closure.
